alert.note: Alert for Fulton; Herkimer; Montgomery (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 3:08PM EDT until August 04 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of eastern New York, including the following counties, Fulton, Herkimer and Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 306 PM EDT, trained weather spotters reported washed out roads in Frankfort due to heavy rain from thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ilion, Herkimer, Little Falls, Mohawk, Frankfort, Dolgeville, Jordanville, Oppenheim, Elizabethtown, Jacksonburg, Fort Herkimer, East Herkimer, Edicks, Wrights Corners, Paines Hollow, Days Rock, Deck, Fink Basin, Smith Corners and Newville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
